name: Prefer UNION ALL to UNION
associatedValueName: The number of UNION (without ALL) occurrences
description: List all objects using UNION (without ALL).
output:
Associated to each artifact with violations, the Quality Rule provides: 
- The number of UNION (without ALL) occurrences
rationale:
In SQL the UNION operator combines the results of two SQL queries into a single table of all matching rows. The two queries must have matching fields and data types in order to join them.
 Any duplicate records are automatically removed unless UNION ALL is used. 
The problem is that MOST of the time it is unnecessary to remove duplicate as there are none and doing the search for duplicate rows can be very costly.
remediation: Add the ALL after the union keyword (ensure that this does not change the returned data)/
remediationSample:
select C1a, C2a
from Table1
union ALL <- Correction here
select C1b, C2b
from Table2
sample:
select C1a, C2a
from Table1
union  <- Failure here
select C1b, C2b
from Table2

=> The database server will read the values, sort them and eliminate duplicates. This is costly and likely to be useless.
total: Number of Client-Server artifacts with a SQL query that contains a UNION or UNION ALL

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance
MIPS-Reduction - focus on data access efficiency
